list_definition.definition: a (large) number of things lying on top of each other in a tidy or untidy heap; a (large) quantity of something lying in a heap

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: There was a neat pile of books in the corner of the room
There was pile of rubbish at the bottom of the garden.

list_definition.definition: a large quantity, especially of money

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: He must have piles of money to own a car like that.

list_definition.definition: to make a pile of (something); to put (something) in a pile

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: He piled the boxes on the table.

list_definition.definition: a large pillar or stake driven into the ground as a foundation for a building, bridge etc

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: The entire city of Venice is built on piles.

list_definition.definition: the thick soft surface of carpets and some kinds of cloth eg velvet

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: The rug has a deep/thick pile.
